Syndrom

Cybersecurity Researcher & Linux Technologist

About Me

[4th Year B.Sc IT | GPA 3.65]

Hi, I'm Senal Dilanjana Kandanaarachchi (aka Syndrom), a Linux-native technologist and IT undergraduate at the University of Vavuniya. I'm obsessed with system administration, workflow automation, and breaking systems to understand how they work.

Recently, I completed the TryHackMe Advent of Cyber (2025) and Pre-Security paths, gaining hands-on experience in **SIEM (Splunk)**, **Malware Analysis**, and **Network Traffic Analysis**. I love building secure, self-hosted infrastructures and exploring the intersection of security and automation.

Featured Projects

A collection of tools, automation workflows, and research projects focused on cybersecurity and system optimization.

DisasterWatch

A full-stack MERN mobile and web application for disaster reporting and management. Led a team of 8 and served as the main developer.

React Native, Expo, MongoDB, Express

RustySec

A comprehensive Rust-based cybersecurity toolkit featuring network scanners, password auditors, and security automation tools.

Rust, Bash, Docker, Network Security

Home Lab Automation

Secure self-hosted infra using Podman and n8n. Automated system administration and logging with Cloudflare Tunnel isolation.

n8n, Podman, Arch Linux, Cloudflared

Arch Hyprland Dotfiles

Advanced personal configuration for Arch Linux and Hyprland, optimized for security research and developer productivity.

Bash, Lua, Hyprland, Wayland

SynShell CLI

A suite of custom CLI tools developed in Bash and Python to streamline security audits and system tasks.

Bash, Python, CLI, Automation
